DOC.detailed_description: Migraine highly prevalent , debilitate costly disorder . Eighteen percent woman 6 % men affect migraine ; neurovascular disorder characterize severe recurrent headache pain episode involve nausea , photophobia , phonophobia aversion physical activity . There increase evidence obesity exacerbate migraine . Obesity associate frequent headache episodic migraineurs , risk factor progression chronic migraine . Several plausible mechanism propose underlie migraine-obesity link include common pro-inflammatory process , psychological condition comorbid disorder ( e.g. , depression ) , similar behavioral risk factor ( e.g. , low physical activity high fat intake ) . No research date examine impact standard behavioral weight loss program migraine obese adult . Behavioral weight loss program focus improve diet physical activity consistently produce weight loss 8-10 kg 6 month reduces risk diabetes improves cardiovascular disease risk factor . Weight loss may also improve physiological , psychological , behavioral pathway purportedly link migraine obesity . Thus , behavioral weight loss program may serve innovative approach treat migraine headache . This study involve randomize controlled trial examine efficacy behavioral weight loss treatment migraine . One hundred forty obese female meet research criterion migraine , confirm study neurologist completion electronic headache diary assign 16 weekly group session either : ( 1 ) Behavioral weight loss ( BWL ) treatment ( n=70 ) ( 2 ) Healthy Living Migraine Relief ( HLMR ) education ( n=70 ) . BWL provide combination empirically validate diet exercise prescription behavior change strategy self-monitoring , goal-setting stimulus control . HLMR provide education migraine pharmacological behavioral ( e.g. , stress management ) treatment . Both group use smartphones record headaches 4 week time pre-treatment , post-treatment , end 16-week weight maintenance period . Weight potential physiological ( inflammation ) , psychological ( depression ) , behavioral ( diet physical activity ) mediator treatment effect assess end treatment test prospective effect migraine day post-treatment .
